page.title: 12The village of Cuckney.
page.content: Cuckney is larger than Norton and the busy A60 and A616 roads form a crossroads there .Most of the housing is along the quieter A616.Nearly all of the properties in the village are rented from the Welbeck Estate and many housed workers in the village's 3 cotton mills in the 18th century. The primary school in the village is the result of the conversion of one of these mills by the Duke of Portland in 1848. The village has its own cricket field with teams playing in the local leagues,before retiring to the popular Greendale Oak pub.The pub does a thriving lunchtime and evening meal trade. Close to the pub are the church and the church hall.The hall is a focal point of village life ,being used among other things to house a Tuesday lunch provided for pensioners.
